arts.ttl: Udinese’s Runjaic: “We Have More Than Just Solet’s Red Card to Be Angry About”
arts.sum: Udinese's head coach Kosta Runjaic expressed his deep disappointment following his team's 4-1 defeat against Como. In a post-match press conference, Runjaic didn't mince words about his team's performance and attitude. The post Udinese’s Runjaic: “We Have More Than Just Solet’s Red Card to Be Angry About” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Como vs Udinese to round out MD21
arts.sum: Como and Udinese are two of the three teams, along with Genoa, that haven’t scored a penalty in Serie A this season; on the other hand, only Venezia (six) have conceded more penalty goals than the Lariani and Friulians (both five, alongside Cagliari and Genoa). Lorenzo Lucca has scored seven goals in 19 matches in the current league season, and is just one away from equalling his total from the previous Serie A campaign.

arts.ttl: ‘I saw the ball there and just decided to go for it’ - James Abankwah on getting booked seconds into his Watford debut
arts.sum: Abankwah (21) completed his loan move from Udinese, Watford’s sister club, only last week, following Ebosele who made a similar switch earlier this season but was pitched straight into the first team by Cleverley for Watford’s game away to Derby County, and a clean sheet was a platform for the side to go on and take home a 2-0 win. Abankwah’s Ireland U-21 teammate Sam Curtis also enjoyed a successful debut, for St Johnstone, with a win and a clean sheet in their Scottish FA Cup tie at home to Motherwell.
